author: Scott Mervis / Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
title: Daya wins her first Grammy
text:
Daya wins her first Grammy February 12, 2017 5:30 PM Singer Daya perform during the Rock Steelers Style fashion show at Stage AE, Oct. 7, 2016. By Scott Mervis / Pittsburgh Post-Gazette 
Mt. Lebanon pop star Daya has won her first Grammy. 
The 18-year-old singer from Mt. Lebanon, whose real name is Grace Tandon, won best dance recording for her vocal on the four-time platinum Chainsmokers’ song “Don't Let Me Down." 
Accepting in the Sunday afternoon premiere ceremony, she thanked the New York electronic duo for reaching out to her and thanked her mom “for moving mountains for me and the rest of my family for being there for me.” 
The song was previously nominated, but did not win, at the MTV Video Music Awards and the American Music Awards.
